title: On safari in Colombia: Luxury tented camps brought to life by corocora birds and white-tailed deer
text:
You know you're in a foreign land when you wake to the sound of chachalaca. They're the most social birds in Los Llanos, a remote region in eastern Colombia, and they drag you from unconsciousness with an outraged squabbling and gabbling.

"Chacachalaca... Chachalaca! Chacha...? Chacha! CHACHALACAA!"

It's a right old rumpus. Perhaps one of them had ventured the idea that Manchester United will one day win the Premier League again.

But such is the rhythm of life in Corocora, a new wildlife camp in the vanguard of luxury tourism and its quest for new places and experiences. Even five years ago most of Colombia was beyond the reach of safe travel, but as the political situation eases so adventurous...
description: You know you're in a foreign land when you wake to the sound of chachalaca.
